p: Zika virus (genus Flavivirus, family Flaviviridae), was first isolated in the Zika forest of Uganda in 1947 [ 79]. Since the Yap island epidemic in 2007, ZIKV has circulated on all continents except Europe [ 80]. There are three main lineages: two from Africa and one from Asia [ 81]. It is transmitted to humans (urban cycle) and primates (sylvatic cycle) by mosquitoes of the Aedes genus. In North-Western Europe, Ae. albopictus (France, Germany) and Ae. japonicus (Germany) are competent mosquitoes [ 8, 37, 46]. Conversely, Culex pipiens s.l. and Cx. pipiens molestus are not competent for ZIKV [ 8].
